data.title: Elio Vittorini (diretto da) - Il Politecnico - 1975
data.meta_description:
The Polytechnic. Directed by Elio Vittorini.
From no. 1 of 29 September 1945 at n. 39 December 1947.
Printed cardboard box. REPRINT on behalf of Giulio Einaudi Editore,
1975. All published including the editorial box set and the presentation bifolio.
Elio Vittorini chose the same title as Carlo Cattaneo's magazine for his periodical.
The editorial staff of Il Politecnico was composed of Franco Calamandrei, Franco Fortini,
Vito Pandolfi. Graphics by Albe Steiner. Every number, which in the early days fulfilled
also to the task of "mural newspaper", that is, glued on the walls of Milan,
presented alongside a leading article, often by Vittorini,
articles on politics, history, economics, art criticism, philosophy, investigations,
poetic and narrative texts, both Italian and foreign, with new translations
from Hemingway, Mayakovsky, Boris Pasternak, Bertold Brecht, Ernst Bloch.
Box cm. 30 x 22.5 (some tiny stains on the spine).
The interior is like new. Overall in very good condition.
